missions.name: Vostok 1
missions.description: First human spaceflight. Yuri Gagarin completed one orbit of Earth in 108 minutes, marking a pivotal moment in space exploration history.

missions.name: Apollo 11
missions.description: First crewed mission to land on the Moon. Armstrong and Aldrin spent 21.5 hours on the lunar surface while Collins orbited above.

missions.name: Apollo 13
missions.description: Intended third crewed lunar landing. An oxygen tank explosion forced mission abort, but crew returned safely in a dramatic rescue operation.

missions.name: Viking 1
missions.description: First successful Mars lander. Transmitted detailed images and conducted experiments searching for signs of life on the Martian surface.

missions.name: Voyager 1
missions.description: Grand tour of the outer solar system. Now in interstellar space, it's the most distant human-made object from Earth.

missions.name: Voyager 2
missions.description: Only spacecraft to visit Uranus and Neptune. Provided unprecedented views of the ice giants and their moons.

missions.name: STS-1 Columbia
missions.description: First Space Shuttle mission. Demonstrated the capability of a reusable spacecraft system for future orbital operations.

missions.name: STS-51-L Challenger
missions.description: Tragic mission that ended 73 seconds after launch due to O-ring failure. Led to significant safety improvements in spaceflight.

missions.name: Mir Space Station
missions.description: First modular space station. Operated for 15 years and hosted international crews, paving the way for the ISS.

missions.name: Hubble Space Telescope
missions.description: Deployed by Space Shuttle Discovery. Revolutionary space telescope that has transformed our understanding of the universe.

missions.name: Mars Pathfinder
missions.description: Delivered the Sojourner rover to Mars. Demonstrated a low-cost approach to planetary exploration.

missions.name: Cassini-Huygens
missions.description: Mission to Saturn. Discovered liquid methane seas on Titan and geysers on Enceladus. Mission ended with controlled dive into Saturn.

missions.name: ISS Zarya Module
missions.description: First component of the International Space Station launched. Beginning of the largest international space cooperation project.

missions.name: STS-107 Columbia
missions.description: Disintegrated during re-entry due to heat shield damage. Led to eventual retirement of the Space Shuttle program.

missions.name: Spirit Rover
missions.description: Mars Exploration Rover that operated for over 6 years. Discovered evidence of past water activity on Mars.

missions.name: Opportunity Rover
missions.description: Operated for nearly 15 years on Mars. Traveled over 45 kilometers and provided invaluable geological data.

missions.name: Chang'e 1
missions.description: China's first lunar orbiter. Mapped the entire lunar surface and analyzed surface composition.

missions.name: Phoenix Mars Lander
missions.description: Landed in Martian arctic region. Confirmed presence of water ice just below the surface.

missions.name: Kepler Space Telescope
missions.description: Discovered thousands of exoplanets. Revolutionized our understanding of planetary systems beyond our own.

missions.name: Curiosity Rover
missions.description: Car-sized rover exploring Gale Crater. Continues to investigate Mars' past habitability and climate history.

missions.name: Mars Orbiter Mission
missions.description: India's first interplanetary mission. Demonstrated cost-effective Mars exploration capability.

missions.name: Chang'e 3
missions.description: First soft landing on the Moon since 1976. Deployed the Yutu rover for lunar surface exploration.

missions.name: Rosetta Mission
missions.description: First spacecraft to orbit and land on a comet. Provided unprecedented data on comet composition and behavior.

missions.name: Falcon 9 First Landing
missions.description: First successful vertical landing of an orbital rocket. Pioneered reusable rocket technology.

missions.name: Juno
missions.description: Jupiter orbiter studying the planet's composition, gravity, magnetic field, and polar magnetosphere.

missions.name: InSight Lander
missions.description: First mission to study Mars' deep interior. Deployed seismometer to detect marsquakes and measure internal heat.

missions.name: Chang'e 4
missions.description: First spacecraft to land on the far side of the Moon. Conducting unprecedented radio astronomy experiments.

missions.name: Beresheet
missions.description: First privately funded Moon mission attempt. Crashed during landing but demonstrated commercial lunar exploration viability.

missions.name: Crew Dragon Demo-2
missions.description: First crewed commercial spacecraft to ISS. Restored US capability to launch astronauts from American soil.

missions.name: Perseverance Rover
missions.description: Most advanced Mars rover. Searching for signs of ancient microbial life and collecting samples for future return to Earth.

missions.name: Ingenuity Helicopter
missions.description: First powered flight on another planet. Technology demonstrator that exceeded all expectations.

missions.name: Tianwen-1
missions.description: China's first Mars mission with orbiter and rover. Successfully demonstrated independent Mars exploration capability.

missions.name: Hope Mars Mission
missions.description: UAE's first interplanetary mission. Studying Martian atmosphere and weather patterns throughout a Martian year.

missions.name: James Webb Space Telescope
missions.description: Most powerful space telescope ever built. Observing the first galaxies and studying exoplanet atmospheres.

missions.name: DART Mission
missions.description: First planetary defense test mission. Successfully altered the orbit of asteroid Dimorphos through kinetic impact.

missions.name: Artemis I
missions.description: Uncrewed test flight of Orion spacecraft and Space Launch System. First step in returning humans to the Moon.

missions.name: HAKUTO-R Mission 1
missions.description: Japanese commercial lunar lander. Crashed during landing attempt but provided valuable data for future missions.

missions.name: JUICE Mission
missions.description: Jupiter Icy Moons Explorer. Will study Ganymede, Callisto, and Europa to investigate potential habitability.

missions.name: Psyche Mission
missions.description: Mission to a metal-rich asteroid. Will help understand planetary cores and the early solar system.

missions.name: Chandrayaan-3
missions.description: India's successful Moon landing near the south pole. Demonstrated precise landing technology for future missions.

missions.name: Europa Clipper
missions.description: Mission to study Jupiter's moon Europa. Will investigate the subsurface ocean and assess habitability potential.

missions.name: Artemis II
missions.description: First crewed Artemis mission. Will orbit the Moon but not land, testing all systems with crew aboard.

missions.name: Peregrine Mission One
missions.description: First commercial lunar lander under NASA's CLPS program. Propulsion anomaly prevented Moon landing.

missions.name: Nova-C IM-1
missions.description: First commercial spacecraft to soft-land on the Moon. Delivered payloads near the lunar south pole.

missions.name: Starship IFT-3
missions.description: Third integrated flight test of Starship. Achieved orbital velocity and demonstrated in-space payload operations.

missions.name: VIPER Rover
missions.description: Volatiles Investigating Polar Exploration Rover. Will map water ice at the lunar south pole for Artemis missions.

missions.name: Lunar Gateway PPE/HALO
missions.description: First two modules of the Lunar Gateway space station. Will serve as staging point for Moon missions.

missions.name: Artemis III
missions.description: First crewed Moon landing since Apollo 17. Will land near the lunar south pole with first woman and person of color.

missions.name: Mars Sample Return Lander
missions.description: Multi-mission campaign to retrieve samples collected by Perseverance. First phase of returning Mars material to Earth.

missions.name: Dragonfly
missions.description: Rotorcraft lander mission to Titan. Will explore Saturn's largest moon and search for building blocks of life.
